questions.title: You are driving at an intersection and notice that there is no police officer or signal light nearby. A few seconds later a pedestrian appears at the crosswalk towards your side of the road. What do you do?
Motorists are not allowed to change lanes in traffic without:
You see a school bus unloading passengers on the road but have failed to stop your car. This will result in?
You’re descending down a steep hill using manual transmission, what safe driving practice should you use:
Motorists who don’t follow the stopping rules meant for school crossing will incur:
Motorists who don’t follow the stopping rules meant for school crossing will incur:
You’re a G2 driver, what should your blood alcohol level be while driving?
You’ve changed your home address. How soon are you (a licensed driver) supposed to notify the MTO?
You’re changing lanes on a multi-lane highway. What are you supposed to do?
While driving on a highway, on what condition can you drive at a maximum speed limit?

choices.body: Stop your car and yield way to pedestrian.
You have the right of way.
Speed up the pedestrain must wait for you.
Slowing down.
Giving proper signal to fellow motorists.
Checking mirrors.
Failing to stop for a school bus unloading passengers will cost the driver 6 demerit points along with a fine of up to $1,000.
Failing to stop for a school bus unloading passengers will cost the driver 3 demerit points along with a fine of up to $2,000.
Failing to stop for a school bus unloading passengers will cost the driver 6 demerit points along with a fine of up to $2,000.
Safest driving practice here would be to use the breaks.
Safest driving practice here would be to gear down and use the engine to ensure braking.
Safest driving practice here would be to pull the clutch in.
3 demerit points and a substantial fine.
2 demerit points and a substantial fine.
5 demerit points and a substantial fine.
You may overtake as long as you leave 3 meters between you and the bus.
If the door of the bus is closed you may proceed.
You must stop until the signal lights start flashing or until the bus proceeds.
Within 30 days.
Within 6 days.
Within 10 days.
Check your car mirrors before making a move.
Check the signal before making a move.
Check the signal and your car mirrors before making a move.
: You may drive at a maximum speed limit so long as the condition of the traffic deems it safe and it complies with the speed limit.
You may drive at a maximum speed limit so long as you feel comfortable.
There are no conditions, you may always drive at the maximum speed limit.
